block.p: Mike Burke Jr., the head pro at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J., will compete in his sixth United States Open next week at Pebble Beach, Calif.
That was assured when Burke, 43, registered a 72-67-139, five under par, on Tuesday before rain interrupted sectional qualifying at the Canoe Brook Country Club in Summit, N.J.
Mike Burke Jr., the head pro at the Mountain Ridge Country Club in West Caldwell, N.J., will compete in his sixth United States Open next week at Pebble Beach, Calif.
That was assured when Burke, 43, registered a 72-67-139, five under par, on Tuesday before rain interrupted sectional qualifying at the Canoe Brook Country Club in Summit, N.J.
When play resumed yesterday, Craig Parry, who plays on the PGA Tour, qualified with a 68 for 140, finishing second to Burke among the 20 qualifiers.
Only 38 players from the 97 scheduled to play yesterday showed up. Most dropped out because they did not have a chance to gain one of the 20 berths.
''This will be my last U.S. Open,'' Burke said. ''My schedule is too busy to be taking so much time away from Mountain Ridge.''
